name: Objectives
description: Catacombs are deliberate, layered dead-space: tunnels, ossuaries, and chambers built to store what the living couldn’t bear to keep nearby. Down here, air moves like it’s remembering old prayers, and every wall of bones feels one bad decision away from joining the living again.

tableData.result: Trace the oldest tunnel to its shame
Seal the restless tier before it bursts
Smuggle a living soul into the stacks
Return stolen skulls to their bitter niches
Chart forbidden corridors the priests deny exist
Silence the hymn echoing from empty ribs
Steal the jawbone that still whispers oaths
Plant false relics to mislead future mourners
Wake a chosen skeleton to bargain guidance
Collapse a haunted gallery without angering it
Escort a cowardly gravedigger to ancestral depths
Hide a cursed relic among anonymous femurs
Find where the catacombs outgrow their builders
Rebind a loosened spirit to its ossuary
Track stolen bones traded for forbidden favors
Bury a secret name beneath unmarked skulls
Snuff every lantern before the dead notice
Replace a missing spine to complete the pattern
Follow the coldest draft to its keeper
Smuggle contraband prayers past listening skulls
Recover the tongue that still tastes confessions
Mark safe paths without insulting the dead
Guide a lost mourner out before dawn
Offer your blood to unlock sealed stairs
Prove the catacombs are still expanding
Divert floodwater from drowning the quiet dead
Destroy the sigil holding the bones obedient
Lead hunters into a corridor that erases
Exchange your shadow for passage deeper down
Rearrange an ossuary to break an old curse
Steal the candle that never burns out
Soothe the wall of skulls mid-argument
Smuggle a forbidden corpse past vigilant caretakers
Test whether the bones recognize your lineage
Deliver contraband incense to a hidden chapel
Guide a vengeful ghost toward its true grave
Barter with the bone-masons for safe refuge
Witness the birth of a new ossuary
Erase all maps so only you navigate
Harvest teeth needed for a necromantic tithe
Escort a relic-thief to their promised punishment
Wake an ossified oracle for one answer
Trace footsteps that never leave any dust
Sabotage the mortuary bells that rouse sleepers
Protect a single coffin from the hungry walls
Test rumors of a pit that forgets
Bind a wandering skeleton back into formation
Lure something living to appease the catacombs
ACTION + THEME
ROLL TWICE

name: Atmosphere
description: Catacombs are deliberate, layered dead-space: tunnels, ossuaries, and chambers built to store what the living couldn’t bear to keep nearby. Down here, air moves like it’s remembering old prayers, and every wall of bones feels one bad decision away from joining the living again.

tableData.result: Air tastes of candle soot and regret
Ceiling sweats mineral tears onto skulls
Lantern light smears across damp bone
Whispers move where no mouths remain
Dust hangs heavy like unsaid names
Shallow drafts carry the scent of iron
Echoes arrive before the sound itself
Every footstep sounds like distant digging
Cold presses in with patient hands
Silence hums like buried insects
Moist stone breathes a slow confession
Shadows knot between stacked femurs
Air vibrates with half-remembered hymns
The dark feels layered, watching, waiting
Bone walls lean as if listening
Faint scraping, then absolute stillness again
Smell of wet linen and old incense
Drips mark time older than kingdoms
Ceiling arches like a frozen wave
Your breath blooms white in stale gloom
Far-off chains rattle without rhythm
Lantern sputter sounds almost like speech
A low wind circles without source
Floor dust curls around your boots
Every corridor narrows into choking dread
The quiet tastes sour and metallic
Shadows cling to skull sockets hungrily
Darkness seems layered, thick as cloth
Air presses words back into your throat
Smell of charred bone clings to stone
Old wax veins the walls like fungus
Your heartbeat feels impolite, too loud
Ceiling seems lower with each exhale
Invisible drafts paw at your ankles
The gloom feels greasy on skin
Every bone stack leans toward your heat
Far-off chanting swallowed mid-syllable
Silence feels rehearsed, expectant, deliberate
Cold breath brushes ear, then nothing
Pale fungi glow like failing stars
Air tastes like pages left underwater
A murmur rides every shifting shadow
Stale incense battles stubborn grave-musk
Walls seem to tighten with each step
Darkness curls around light like smoke
Moans echo with no clear direction
The air feels recently disturbed
Uneasy stillness hums beneath every stone
ACTION + THEME
ROLL TWICE
